It's more like... do I really want to open the admin panel and dig around in the guts of a forum that is liable to get knocked offline at any moment?

As I said in another thread, I did recently try some preliminary measures toward re-organization the order of the subs but got kicked out of the admin mode twice during my attempt. I'm not going to mess with it again until things have settled down.

Not really, no. All kinds of things - search engines, the Wayback Machine, individual humans running wget - crawl websites to make complete copies of them. "AI" is a horrible blight but the crawlers that run on its behalf are not a new idea at all.

>

> 8 hours ago, damerell said:
> 
> 
> Not really, no. All kinds of things - search engines, the Wayback Machine, individual humans running wget - crawl websites to make complete copies of them. "AI" is a horrible blight but the crawlers that run on its behalf are not a new idea at all.
> 

No, never said that searching for info was a new thing. And nothing exists in a vaccum. So all those things you mentioned are all happening at the same time, but now on top of all that we have fake AI combing through thousands of pages a minute to find info to cobble together into a response that seems intelligent. Real intelligences such as ourselves, carry our knowledge around with us in the most advanced hard drives on the planet. What they call AI these days, are algorithms that are trained to look for key words within a context, and then string searched for information into a defined template.

They are accessing the servers at rates far faster and more often than any humans. The pathways in and out of servers are not infinite, so basically they are causing traffic jams because the servers can't keep up with the routing.
